Calmly resigned to her demise, she embarks on a lonely trek to Harlem to enjoy a final slice of pizza from the restaurant where her late father took her as a child. Horror prequel, starring Lupita Nyongo, Joseph Quinn and Alex Wolff

programme.title: Gravity
programme.desc: Two astronauts are left stranded in orbit above the Earth when the debris from an exploding satellite destroys their shuttle. Left drifting in space with no way to contact mission control, they begin a perilous journey to reach the safety of a space station before their oxygen supply runs out. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney

programme.title: AI: Artificial Intelligence
programme.desc: A highly advanced robotic boy is created with one purpose - to love his owner as a parent. When he is rejected by his mother, he is left to roam the bleak landscapes of a futuristic America with a fellow android, searching for a means of becoming a real boy in the hope of regaining her love. Steven Spielbergs sci-fi drama, starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law, William Hurt and Frances OConnor

programme.title: Insidious
programme.desc: A family experience strange events in their house and become convinced it is haunted. However, after moving on, they find the dark forces have followed them and when their son mysteriously falls into a coma, they must find a way to get rid of the paranormal entities tormenting them. Horror, starring Patrick Wilson and Rose Byrne

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 2
programme.desc: A couple previously tormented by paranormal activity discover their nightmares are not over. As more strange events occur, they turn to a group of paranormal investigators for help in uncovering the dark secrets that connect them to the spirit world. Horror sequel, starring Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne and Barbara Hershey

programme.title: Videodrome
programme.desc: A sleazy TV producer investigates a violent pirate broadcast that may be a real snuff movie. In the process, he uncovers a sinister plot to turn the public into brainless drones through their televisions. David Cronenbergs surreal horror, starring James Woods, Sonja Smits, Deborah Harry and Peter Dvorsky

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: A tough-talking ex-convict pledges to protect an orphan from Mob hitmen determined to bump him off as ruthlessly as they killed his parents. Remake of John Cassavetes thriller, starring Sharon Stone, George C Scott, Jeremy Northam and Jean-Luke Figueroa

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Browns novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno

programme.title: Mob Cops
programme.desc: When a retired NYPD detective publishes a book about his familys mob connections, war breaks out between the police working for the citys big crime boss and the officers trying to bring them to justice. Crime drama, starring David Arquette and Kevin Connolly

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Childs novel One Shot, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: The nomadic vigilante tries to save an army major who has been framed for murder and treason. Jack Reacher discovers that Turner has been targeted by a secret government conspiracy, and together they go on the run to expose the truth. Director Edward Zwicks blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Childs novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Revealed as a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organisation known as Beekeepers, he sets out on a brutal quest of vengeance, hunting those responsible for the incident, who have seriously underestimated how much of a threat he is. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Irons, Minnie Driver and Jemma Redgrave

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalans thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley

programme.title: The Krays
programme.desc: Biopic of the infamous twin brothers who built up a criminal empire in the East End of London during the 1960s. Seizing territory from an already established rival by force, they quickly rose to prominence in the citys gangland culture. However, over time the brothers began to clash, while enemies stood ready to bring them down. Gangster biopic, starring Gary and Martin Kemp, Billie Whitelaw and Tom Bell.

programme.title: Law Abiding Citizen
programme.desc: A man is forced to witness the murder of his wife and daughter, and is driven to despair when one of the perpetrators walks free at trial. Years later, he begins a campaign of vigilante violence, seeking revenge on the killers and the justice system that failed to punish them, particularly an assistant district attorney who allowed the defendant to make a deal during the court proceedings. Thriller, with Gerard Butler and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowes remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original

programme.title: The Thicket
programme.desc: When a band of unlikely heroes pursue a brutal killer in a snowbound wilderness, they follow him into a deadly land known as the Thicket. Director Elliott Lesters drama, starring Peter Dinklage, Juliette Lewis, Gbenga Akinnagbe and Levon Hawke

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Gangsters kill their accountant and his family after he is caught feeding information to the FBI, but his six-year-old son manages to escape. It becomes the job of a tough-talking former showgirl to protect him from the hitmen determined to complete the bloody task they so ruthlessly started. John Cassavetes Neo-noir crime thriller, starring Gena Rowlands, John Adames, Buck Henry and Julie Carmen.

programme.title: Greedy People
programme.desc: A rookie cop is partnered with an unhinged and morally dubious local officer in a small island town. A murder and the discovery of a million dollars soon turns the local communitys lives upside down. Director Potsy Poncirolis comedy, starring Himesh Patel, Lily James and Joseph Gordon-Levitt

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Revealed as a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organisation known as Beekeepers, he sets out on a brutal quest of vengeance, hunting those responsible for the incident, who have seriously underestimated how much of a threat he is. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Irons, Minnie Driver and Jemma Redgrave

programme.title: Fight or Flight
programme.desc: A mercenary is assigned a target on a flight, but when rival assassins board the plane, the hunter and the hunted are forced to team up. Action thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Katee Sackhoff and Julian Kostov

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Autistic number-cruncher Christian Wolff moonlights as a money launderer for the Mob. However, the Treasury Department start closing in on him, so he decides to take on a legitimate client in the form of a robotics company. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Action-packed thriller, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: American Gigolo
programme.desc: A male escort is falsely accused of murdering a wealthy woman, and his only hope of proving his innocence rests with a client reluctant to come forward and provide him with an alibi. Thriller, written and directed by Paul Schrader, starring Richard Gere, Lauren Hutton and Hector Elizondo

programme.title: Angels and Demons
programme.desc: Academic adventurer Robert Langdon is called in by the Vatican to deal with a crisis. Pope Pius XVI has died suddenly and the four cardinals in line to be his successor have all been abducted by a mysterious sect that is threatening to murder them. As he searches for the kidnapped clerics, Langdon discovers the cult has an even more horrific plan in mind involving a stolen canister of anti-matter. Ron Howard takes the reins once again for the sequel to The Da Vinci Code, with Tom Hanks, Ewan McGregor, Ayelet Zurer, Stellan Skarsgard and Pierfrancesco Favino

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Three brothers run an underground bootlegging operation in Depression-era Virginia. However, as their criminal activities become increasingly successful, a corrupt deputy sheriff demands a cut of the profits, forcing them to fight to defend their livelihood. Crime drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Tom Hardy, Jason Clarke, Gary Oldman and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Jack mistakenly donates a pair of Karens favourite shoes to a good cause. Meanwhile, Grace volunteers to help direct an amateur play with Will - a task she pursues with zeal until her social life begins to suffer. American sitcom, starring Eric McCormack

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.sub-title: Hey La, Hey La, My Ex-Boyfriends Back
programme.desc: Wills ex-boyfriend Michael returns, giving the impression that he wants to pick up where they left off. Karen takes stock of her position at Grace Adler Designs and decides she needs more responsibility

programme.title: The Conners
programme.sub-title: Three Exes, Role Playing and a Waterbed
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben. Dan tries to spruce up the bedroom while Louise is out on the road

programme.title: The Conners
programme.sub-title: Spills, Pills and the Midnight Lasagna
programme.desc: The family celebrates when Mark wins an award for high-achievers at his new school. Jackie navigates her new relationship with Neville

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie announces to the girls that she and Aidan have exchanged apartment keys. Miranda has to stay strong when her mother dies, and Samantha learns some new positions from her latest lover - a wrestling coach. Comedy series, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Cynthia Nixon and Kristin Davis

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Miranda discovers Steve has testicular cancer and Carrie tells the girls she has been invited to Aidans country cabin - so Samantha reluctantly volunteers to accompany her. Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Cynthia Nixon and Kristin Davis star

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: Hannah has a potential writing assignment in the pipeline and - in the name of research - she buys some cocaine and heads out for a night on the town with Elijah, who reveals a big secret. Meanwhile, Marnie bumps into artist Booth Jonathan and quickly falls back under his spell

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: Jessa makes a bad impression on Thomas-Johns parents, while Shoshanna has doubts about her relationship with Ray. Hannah forces Elijah to move out and wastes no time in throwing a celebratory dinner party. However, when Marnie makes a surprise appearance, Charlie is caught between girlfriends past and present and the evening quickly goes off the rails

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Chaos ensues at the Dunder Mifflin office when Michael decides to take over conflict resolution duties normally handled by the human resources department

programme.desc: Dunder-Mifflin hosts a charity casino night in the warehouse and Michael tries to juggle two dates. Jim worries about the consequences of his impending transfer

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her break-up, and Dan offers to talk with Aldos dad

programme.title: The Conners
programme.sub-title: Hot for Teacher and Writing a Wrong
programme.desc: Mark returns to school and finds it hard to fit in. Darlene isnt happy when she finds out what hes doing to make a little extra cash

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Four months after Casino Night, Michael inadvertently lets slip that one of his colleagues is gay, Jim adjusts to his new office, promotion and life without Pam

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Michael and Dwight meet Jan at an office supplies convention in Philadelphia. Back in Stanton, Ryan sets off on a double date with Kelly. US remake of the sitcom, starring Steve Carell, Jenna Fischer and David Denman

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: An old school friend visits Will and alarms Grace by asking him to donate his sperm so she can have a baby. Megyn Price guest stars

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Erotic dreams about Grace send Will to a therapist, who seems more interested in dating him than offering any professional advice. Jack talks to Karen about the way she has been treating Rosario. Comedy, guest starring Markus Flanagan

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Miranda tells Steve she is pregnant and he proposes out of a sense of duty - but though she turns him down he insists he still wants to help raise the baby. Carrie agrees to live with Aidan for the sake of convenience, but later fears he wants to get engaged, and Charlotte considers adopting a Chinese baby

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie feels claustrophobic when Aidan moves his clutter in, and the pair end up having cross words. Meanwhile, Miranda wonders whether it is safe to have sex while pregnant, Samantha seems to be falling in love and Trey upsets Charlotte when he gives her a gift - a cardboard baby

programme.title: Life After People

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Actor Laurence Fishburne explores the Hindenburg airship disaster of May 1937, when the craft caught fire while landing in New Jersey. The cause of the blaze, which burst out of the nose, was never fully determined and 35 out of the of 97 people on the airship died. Most of the survivors were severely burned

programme.title: Battle 360
programme.desc: A computer generated re-creation of the events of 1944, in which the US Carrier Task Force forged a path through the Pacific to assault enemy bases at Kwajalein and Truk Lagoon

programme.title: Battle 360

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Craig Charles: UFO Conspiracies
programme.desc: In January 2008, a shadow was cast over the town of Stephenville, Texas, when a UFO passed overhead at supersonic speed. The event was witnessed by scores of stunned locals who remain desperate for answers on what exactly they saw that winters evening. Craig and space journalist Sarah Cruddas talk to eyewitness private pilot Steve Allen who was with friends when he saw a vast UFO passing overhead at a speed estimated to be 2,000mph. He describes the craft as having an array of bright, high-intensity lights at its rear - and pursued by two US Air Force F16 fighter jets. The team discovers that the US military, who initially denied any knowledge of this event, changed their story in the weeks following the incident, adding fuel to the theory that there could be a high-level cover-up

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits archaeological digs in the east of Britain, including new discoveries at a perfectly preserved 3,000-year-old village in Cambridgeshire. She also visits the theatre where Shakespeare premiered Romeo and Juliet and the location of the Battle of Barnet

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: West - Viking Camp and Iron Age Gold
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits archaeological digs around the UK, starting with the west of Britain. programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Search for Alexander the Great
programme.desc: The story of Alexander the Great - the most celebrated warrior king in history - still stirs fascination more than 2,000 years after his death. Laurence Fishburne contemplates what might have happened to the mummy of Alexander the Great

programme.desc: The actor is joined by astrophysicist Sarah Cruddas to recall the events of October 2017, when astronomers at the Pan-STARRS observatory saw an object they named Oumuamua, the very first observed visitor from interstellar space. Craig and Sarah talk to Senior Astronomer Dr Seth Shostak of the SETI Institute, who shares his theories of what Oumuamua could possibly be and postulates that the very fact it entered the solar system at all is the best argument of all for it being alien

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The Guadalajara Open. Coverage of day five of the WTA 500 event, a hard-court tournament at Panamerican Tennis Center in Mexico. After beating the number one seed in the previous round, Marina Stakusic saw her quest for the title come to an end at this stage 12 months ago when she lost 6-4, 6-3 to Magdalena Frech, while Olivia Gadecki, who had previously defeated the number two seed, booked her place in the semi-finals with a 6-2. 3-6, 6-1 win over Martina Trevisan

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Captain Blackadder is put on trial for killing and eating General Melchetts carrier pigeon. Rowan Atkinson stars in Ben Elton and Richard Curtiss comedy, with Tony Robinson and Stephen Fry

programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Alyshea and Maculay worry about the welfare of their premature baby, who was born with lung problems and susceptible to infection and has been carefully monitored at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Samantha and Paul didnt have a chance to enjoy the birth of their first baby due to a complication during delivery, but their nerves are not helped by ending up in the same room on almost the same date. Meanwhile, Kevin and Emma are looking forward to becoming parents, after being forced to postpone their wedding and exotic travels plans

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team meet Rob and Michelle Wall and their son Noah. The couple live in a small 18th-century house in Cumbria, which is currently a half-finished renovation project that had to be put on hold when Noah was born with spina bifida. Designer Charlie Luxton is tasked with making the cold and unsafe property a special haven for the family - and as always an army of local tradesmen turn out in force to help make the dream a reality

programme.desc: Its the very first day of Sweet Week, and the remaining contestants must take their cue from a very gooey Mystery Box and incorporate an element of goo into a dessert

programme.desc: Stacey meets single mum-of-eight Marie Buchan, a lightning rod in the fierce debate over the UK benefits system who has openly shared her state-funded lifestyle

programme.title: Louis Theroux: The City Addicted to Crystal Meth
programme.desc: The roving journalist examines how drug addiction has torn apart the city of Fresno in Central Valley, California. In addition to meeting a couple whose crystal meth use has lost them custody of their five children, he talks to a mother trying to kick the habit to make up for missing her daughters childhood, and witnesses the work being carried out at residential centre Westcare, which offers rehabilitation programmes

programme.desc: The Auckland Rescue Helicopter crew are dispatched to a critical situation when a drag racer smashes into a concrete wall

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: Four people are left fighting to keep their heads above water when their boat sinks in the Firth of Thames

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete to get their big break in the world of commercial interior design. For their first challenge, head judge Michelle Ogundehin asks them to transform five upmarket rental apartments in Manchester. Working in pairs, the designers must take on a living room or master bedroom, and then work together on a shared home office

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr take on their first project - designing a Sicilian kitchen. Kicking off the demolition in 36-degree heat proves to be a trial for Alan, and he soon realises that taking on a build in a medieval hilltop town comes with its own unique challenges. With the help of Project Manager Scott, Amanda barters with the locals at a nearby marble factory as she bags a bargain for their feature island and brushes up on her culinary skills in Marsala, learning how to cook Sicilys signature dish

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Rhiannon, who has cystic fibrosis, prepares to risk her life to have a third child, while an unexpected turn of events during labour means Kirsty and her partner, retired soldier Ian, must alter their birth plan. Plus, single mum SammiJo relies on her mum to help her bond with her second baby in a way she couldnt when her first child was born

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Hereford couple Colin and Clare Gibbons, whose life together fell apart in 2012 when their eldest son Christopher was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, one of the most severe forms of the condition. Despite having a lovely house, it needs adapting to Christophers needs for both now and in the future, so the DIY SOS team - bolstered by dozens of local tradespeople - descend on the property to add a two-storey extension, with designer Julia Kendell on hand to ensure they stick to her vision while adding a few finishing touches of her own

programme.title: First Responders

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants are sent to Wotton House, a grand hotel in the Surrey Hills, where they must each transform one of the nine bedrooms to create a space that reflects their signature style but with an eccentric British twist. The designers relish the challenge, embracing the idea of British eccentricity, although some take a more liberal approach, leading to surprising results. Alan Carr follows their progress, while helping Michelle Ogundehin survey the spaces is guest judge Guy Oliver, who has designed the interiors for some of the best-known hotels in London

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr set about renovating the bathrooms. Amanda is unconvinced about Alans bidet and Alan tries to veto Amandas disco ball installation - but neither will back down on their vision. In Alans quest to stay true to Sicilian culture, he treats Amanda to a visit to Marsalas salt pans for a unique spa experience. Amandas dreams of a roll-top bath come crashing down as Alan sets her the task of recycling the apartments existing one, but karma kicks in as his DIY skills are pushed to the limit with a masterclass in floor tiling

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey from the Midlands to the West Country, beginning in Derby, where he visits the citys famous 19th-century railway works. In Leicester he looks back to the early 1970s, when around 10,000 Asians arrived in the city after being expelled from Uganda by the dictator Idi Amin. He also hears how meat rationing during the Second World War led to the birth of Walkers crisps, still produced in the city

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the citys gothic cathedral in November 1940. He visits the factory of the London Electric Vehicle Company, manufacturers of the iconic London taxi, and then heads south to Royal Leamington Spa and the national centre for the Guide Dogs for the Blind

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Warwickshire, where he gets a glimpse of the work being done for the new HS2 railway infrastructure. In Stratford-upon-Avon he learns about the founding of the Royal Shakespeare Company, before a visit to Birmingham, where he recalls the redevelopment of the city centre during the 1960s and the arrival of black and Asian communities

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops in Wolverhampton, where he finds out about the impact of Enoch Powells 1968 speech. He also visits Kingsford Country Park on the outskirts of Kidderminster, investigates pigeon-racing in Worcester, and eventually looks into Cheltenhams jazz festival

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dereks on his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest priced item at the next auction. But, the 1970 Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Over the years Derek has learnt to always expect the unexpected. So when Call the Midwife star Cliff Parisi drops off his Bedford CA campervan its just another day at the office

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitzs purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: As Hitlers troops advance, occupants in Ukraine, Belarus and Poland take the brunt of the occupying forces cruelty; and the first concentration camps are created

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Waltham Forest Town Hall in east London, where items of interest include an Art Deco pendant that may have been constructed around an ancient Egyptian scarab beetle more 3,000 years ago, an enamel Chinese box discovered among a 20p car-boot haul and a huge collection of early 20th-century tiles discovered behind a chimney. Other highlights include a 1960s jacket with a Beatles connection and a purse that saved a German soldiers life in the First World War. Fiona also celebrates Walthamstows most famous son, designer William Morris, exploring his Arts and Crafts Style and his passion for politics

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Liverpool Metropolitan Cathedral, where members of the public bring along their treasured antiques and collectibles. Items include a miniature kitchen range crafted in metal, a fragment of a 12th-century Hindu sculpture found buried in a garden and a 1970s barbers chair. Other highlights include a chunky merchants ring that could date back to the 15th century and items once belonging to Capt Arthur Rostron, whose ship, the Carpathia, came to the aid of the Titanic

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team opt to buy one of the most affordable sports cars on the road - the Mazda MX-5

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team pay over the odds for a VW Campervan, but can they hope to break even when they turn out a lovely bus for auction

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitzs purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: As Hitlers troops advance, occupants in Ukraine, Belarus and Poland take the brunt of the occupying forces cruelty; and the first concentration camps are created

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Waltham Forest Town Hall in east London, where items of interest include an Art Deco pendant that may have been constructed around an ancient Egyptian scarab beetle more 3,000 years ago, an enamel Chinese box discovered among a 20p car-boot haul and a huge collection of early 20th-century tiles discovered behind a chimney. programme.title: Tropic of Cancer with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon traces the path of the northern tropic around the globe, a journey in which he explores the environment, culture, history, politics and people of 18 countries. He begins in Baja California on Mexicos Pacific coast, crossing the countrys rugged interior, before heading east to Cuba and ending the first leg in the Bahamas

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Charlie head south for an immaculate Lotus Super 7. Derek and Jack are in Sheffield collecting a 1929 Riley Monaco and a 1924 Alvis 12/50 tourer

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will Trickett and Gus Gregory head to the West Country to buy a Golf GTI. Gus hates it on sight, but Will is smitten. They soon discover why the car is laid up - it has no engine

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team lift the shutters on their biggest restoration to date in the shape of a Series 1 Land Rover. But does that mean record profit or history making loss?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A collection of Austin Mini Metros arrive for auction. A baby Fiat 850 coupe also goes under the hammer and a haulier offloads part of his vintage commercial vehicle collection

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon OBrien repurposes some old suitcases, while Henry Cole gives an old dresser some serious bling

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Featuring Italian ruins immortalised by Hollywood, a crumbling Chilean city with two lives and a brutalist Scottish relic whose prayers went unanswered

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel leads him on railway journey through the modern south Indian states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. He travels from the former princely state of Mysuru, aka Mysore, to the first stronghold of the East India Company in Chennai, formerly Madras

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britains post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on train journeys through Edwardian Britain, exploring the grand estates of Norfolk and a bivouac on Brownsea Island on the way. He also learns the ropes aboard an Edwardian wherry on the Norfolk Broads

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Letchworth Garden City to Herne Hill
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores an Edwardian utopia in Letchworth, where he meets a fourth generation citizen who introduces him to the towns community spirit. He then heads towards London, and discovers a favoured haunt of King Edward VII, before sampling the monarchs favourite tipple, the Kings Ginger

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Croydon, where he hears the story of a mixed-race composer who was once celebrated but is now forgotten. At Three Bridges station, he is delighted to find a recently built depot and its fleet of new Class 700 trains - and is given the great honour of washing one down. In Lewes, he makes a beeline for Charleston, the home of artists Vanessa Bell and Duncan Grant, and in Shoreham-by-Sea, Michael discovers how magnificent Edwardians in flying machines took off from the oldest licensed airport in the country

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek picks up an impressive five vehicle haul from a collector who can no longer look after his motors. Pauls out on the road collecting a rare 1972 Lancia Fulvia Berlina

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek casts his eye over a Citroen 2CV, before he is off admiring the treasure trove of more than 270 motorbikes in the same garage

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: The Red Army develops strength and Hitlers Spring Offensive is stopped at Stalingrad; and in the largest ghetto the inhabitants fight back in the Warsaw Uprising

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Liverpool Metropolitan Cathedral, where finds include a sketch by LS Lowry, a 17th-century longcase clock, a model of a local ship that was once the fastest to cross the Atlantic, and a miniature piano that opens up to reveal a couple of secrets inside. The Dean of the Cathedral asks for help in identifying a mysterious chest found in 2009, having been bricked up behind a wall, and expert Andy McDonnell tells a tale of skulduggery when he encounters work by glass-maker Elizabeth Graydon-Stannus

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Belton House in Lincolnshire, where items of interest include a piece of cloth bearing the standard of Oliver Cromwell, reportedly snatched from his funeral cortege in 1658. The experts also find a collection of Chairman Mao memorabilia amassed by a teacher during a stay in China, a purse that conceals a tiny pistol, a bronze sculpture of Joan of Arc, jewellery designed by Carl Faberge, and an illustrated page of British wildflowers that could be a genuine work by renowned botanist William Keble Martin

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A 1969 Morris Mini Cooper MkII is totally restored by specialists. They give it the full works, which means only one thing... any chance of profit heads towards an open window

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team set out on a Pre-War challenge with a 1939 three wheeled Morgan F4 - and aptly named Russ Storer from MG Mecca is still keen to take it on

programme.title: Tropic of Cancer with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon continues to trace the path of the northern tropic around the globe, joining travellers on the coast of Western Sahara to partake in the extreme sport of kite surfing, and meeting activists who campaign for indigenous peoples rights. He continues on through the worlds largest minefield, takes a gruelling train ride across Mauritania and visits huge refugee camps in the Algerian desert

programme.title: Allo Allo!
programme.desc: The end of the war sees Rene, Edith and the rest of the gang welcoming in the Allied troops, and they soon find that the invasion party includes a couple of old friends

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor Meldrew finds himself forced into early retirement, but is determined not to end up on the scrapheap, pouring scorn on the modern world and driving everybody crazy in the process. Richard Wilson stars in the first-ever episode as misery guts Meldrew, with Annette Crosbie as his long-suffering wife. From 1990

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret tries to take Victors mind off his depressing situation by encouraging him to attend a fitness class and read a book on how to cope with old age. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.desc: The team fly the flag for King and country with one of their most luxurious purchases to date - a 1981 Rolls-Royce Silver Spirit

The calfs protective mother is making it clear she wants her baby back, and Jennie does not want to distress her, so has to work fast. Vet Darren treats a two-day-old lamb, whose owner thinks has a urinary infection. However, when she happily relieves herself all over Darrens examination table, he has to use all his investigative skills to diagnose the real problem. Maurice King, the founder of the Downe Veterinary Clinic, encounters a loggerhead turtle has been rescued by the local sea life sanctuary

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs

Paul also meets a former racing greyhound who has spent most of his time in kennels, and is ready for life in a domestic home

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Colonel and Joan Maltravers host a dinner party to celebrate their sons return from Kenya but the meal is disrupted by an armed robbery. David gives chase to the thief and becomes a local hero - much to the exasperation of Bernie. Liz has a difficult decision to make after receiving an exciting offer from Ben. Guest starring Simon Williams, his wife Lucy Fleming and their son Tam Williams

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Paris falls to the Germans with not a single shot fired and Webster begins a campaign of resistance under the nose of the Nazis at the American hospital, while in Berlin, Mr and Mrs Rossler are arrested for neglecting their patriotic duties. Harry has returned home to Manchester with one of the Senegalese troops who stayed by his side to transport soldiers off Dunkirk beach, and is dumbfounded to learn that a newly formed special operations unit is interested in having him on board. Lois finds herself growing closer to Vernon
